questions.question: Soto showed thoughtfulness toward others when he

choices.answer: spit on a grape before eating it
handed the first sandwich to his mother
lists what he wants to buy with his wages
arranges his wardrobe to make it look larger

questions.question: What did Soto buy with the money he earned in the fields?

choices.answer: a radio
food for his family
clothing for school
a present for his mother

questions.question: From the author's perspective, one advantage of chopping cotton was that he

choices.answer: worked with Tejanos
got to sing to himself in the field
rode to work in a bus
earned money by the hour

questions.question: Soto decided to pick grapes "one last time" because

choices.answer: he had not found another job
the pay was better than cutting cotton
his mother asked him to work
he wanted to show that he was tough
talk aimlessly
complain angrily
take a great risk
fail to act quickly
someone who works in a store
a company owner
the leader of a work crew
a bus driver
sore
poor
tired
weak
too loud
a little late
very angry
partially sorry

questions.question: You can tell that Soto at first had a positive perspective about work when he says that he

choices.answer: would end his family's misery with his wages
cut more grapes than anyone else in the field
eat grapes in the field as if they were popcorn
have a hard time listening to his mother's stories

questions.question: What did Soto do that shows you that he began to realize the price of things?

choices.answer: took a bus with his brother to the cotton field
felt embarrassed by his clothes
daydreamed in the field and sang to himself
stopped imagining a new copper teapot

questions.question: What sensory details does Soto use to describe his poverty as a young man?

choices.answer: how his clothes looked
what swimming felt like
how popcorn tasted at the mall
what his brother's car sounded like

questions.question: Soto decided that chopping cotton was "too good" because he

choices.answer: found that cotton fields were less dusty than grape fields
felt less sore after chopping cotton
made more money in a day than he had ever made
found that he was able to daydream more when chopping cotton
carry tools on your back
gather up a crop, such as grain
walk slowly to avoid finishing a task
bend forward and downward
someone who works long hours outside for very little pay
someone who provides services for an agreed price
a person who specializes in tearing down buildings
a person who imagines spending wages before earning them
a partial payment of what is owed
a temporary agreement between opponents
an unpleasant situation that is difficult to leave
something that exists only in one's imagination
